Issues.Title: Setting markAsTouched() on a FormControl with CVA doesn't call the registered onTouched callback.
Issues.Body:
### Relevant Package
This feature request is for @angular/forms


### Description
I setup a custom form control with multiple fields using the ControlValueAccessor. Once it was wired up and working, I called "markAsTouched()" on the form control from the parent component, expecting the callback function onTouched that I registered via RegisterOnTouched to be called. It wasn't.


### Describe the solution you'd like
Call the registered touch function when the control is touched programmatically.  Or expose a method such as setTouchedState (https://github.com/angular/angular/issues/27315) and then access it the same way the validate(ctrl: AbstractControl) method is accessed, via the multi-provider NG_VALIDATORS.


### Describe alternatives you've considered
1. Create a separate "@Input" binding on the component through which to pass its touched status.
2. Inject the NgControl and listen directly to it for touched (although there also exists no easy way to listen to touched/dirty/pristine statuses).

Here is a reproduction of the issue:
https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-cva-example-ng-conf

Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report ### Affected Package The issue is caused by package @angular/router ### Is this a regression? Not as far as I know. ### Description Adding a guard to a route configuration (e.g. in `canActivate`) without also adding it to the providers array causes builds to fail with the error `Cannot read property 'loadChildren' of undefined`. This error message is not very helpful and makes it hard to figure out what the problem is. It looks like it is an error of the build process itself rather than a message intended to be seen by the end user. A better message should at the very least indicate the problem is a bad route configuration, and preferably also include which route it is and what the exact problem is. The following code, either used as the root module or included in it (with `.forChild` instead of `.forRoot` in that case), is enough to reproduce the problem: ```typescript import {NgModule} from '@angular/core'; import {RouterModule} from '@angular/router'; class BugGuard {} @NgModule({ imports: [ RouterModule.forRoot([{path: '', canActivate: [BugGuard]}]) ] }) export class BugModule {} ``` The error disappears entirely if `providers: [BugGuard]` is added to the NgModule or if `, canActivate: [BugGuard]` is removed from the route (though there are several other things wrong with this code due to making it as short and simple as possible, so it wouldn't work anyway). ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction https://github.com/a-speer/angular-bug-repro-router-loadchildren-undefined Relevant code is in `src/app/app-routing.module.ts`. Issues.Title: ServerBuilder: bundleDependencies "none" no longer works on Windows
Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) ``` - [ ] new - [x] build - [ ] serve - [ ] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] xi18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ``` ### Is this a regression? Yes, the previous version in which this bug was not present was: `@angular/cli v8.0.0-beta.4` or `@angular-devkit/build-angular v0.14.0-beta.4` (before commit 309b483). ### Description Commit 309b483 add **changes on server builder model** (`packages/angular_devkit/build_angular/src/angular-cli-files/models/webpack-configs/server.ts`) **which breaks option `"bundleDependencies": "none"` on Windows**. ```diff @@ -45,23 +36,15 @@ export function getServerConfig(wco: WebpackConfigOptions) { if (wco.buildOptions.bundleDependencies == 'none') { config.externals = [ /^@angular/, - // tslint:disable-next-line:no-any - (_: any, request: any, callback: (error?: any, result?: any) => void) => { + (context: string, request: string, callback: (error?: null, result?: string) => void) => { // Absolute & Relative paths are not externals if (request.match(/^\.{0,2}\//)) { return callback(); } try { - // Attempt to resolve the module via Node - const e = require.resolve(request); - if (/node_modules/.test(e)) { - // It's a node_module - callback(null, request); - } else { - // It's a system thing (.ie util, fs...) - callback(); - } + require.resolve(request); + callback(null, request); } catch { // Node couldn't find it, so it must be user-aliased callback(); ``` **After these changes, main server entry path will be consider as external/node module** (because `require.resolve` succeeded to resolve main server entry path). Consequently: * bundle server succeded to build but main server entry isn't transpile ; * bundle server run crashes due to syntax error from typescript instructions. Issues.Body:
We only use it for a few things but have a strict peerdep.

This strictness causes errors when updating the CLI from 7.x to 8.x projects:
```
Package "@angular/compiler-cli" has an incompatible peer dependency to "typescript" (requires ">=3.1.1 <3.2", would install "3.4.5").
```

`build-angular` did not have a peerdep in 7.x so this never was a problem.

This PR relaxes the peerdep to `">=3.1 < 3.5"`, which covers the 3.1 used in initial CLI 7.0 projects.

Issues.Title: fix(breakpoint-observer): fix the breakpoint observer emit count and accuracy
Issues.Body:
The breakpoint observer emits multiple and incorrect states when more than one query changes.
Debounce the observer emissions to eliminate the incorrect states and emit once.

References [#10925](https://github.com/angular/components/issues/10925)

I have reproduced this in Chrome, Firefox, Safari, Edge, and IE. It occurs because the media query API fires an event when a query match changes. The breakpoint observer emits once for each event, updating the state of one query each time. Therefore, the observer may emit multiple times for one change and the reported intermediary states can be incorrect. I have reproduced up to five emissions for a single change.

[https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-6pmabc](https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-6pmabc)

> matches: false 
> breakpoints:
> {
>   "(max-width: 599.99px)": false,
>   "(min-width: 600px) and (max-width: 959.99px)": false,
>   "(min-width: 960px) and (max-width: 1279.99px)": false,
>   "(min-width: 1280px) and (max-width: 1919.99px)": false,
>   "(min-width: 1920px)": false
> }
> matches: true 
> breakpoints:
> {
>   "(max-width: 599.99px)": false,
>   "(min-width: 600px) and (max-width: 959.99px)": true,
>   "(min-width: 960px) and (max-width: 1279.99px)": false,
>   "(min-width: 1280px) and (max-width: 1919.99px)": false,
>   "(min-width: 1920px)": false
> }

PR [#11007](https://github.com/angular/components/pull/11007) attempted to resolve this issue. However, the issue still reproduces. My understanding is that the AsapScheduler uses a microtask which fails to debounce the media query events. Using the AsyncScheduler resolves the issue. AsyncScheduler uses a timer, setInterval, that may technically be slower on the first bounce but is more efficient across multiple.

Mind my ignorance with Angular testing. I chose to replace flush with task to maintain test coverage.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(breakpoint-observer): fix the breakpoint observer emit count and accuracy" (#15964)

Issues.Title: Overlay: Allow tall modals to overflow the viewport height
Issues.Body:
#### Please describe the feature you would like to request.

Overlay.position() should offer a way to display really tall modals without adjusting their height to max 100% of the viewport/backdrop. 

current positioning:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/42932011/57150537-dd008480-6dce-11e9-870d-478809a7c585.png)

as you see the panel stretches only as tal as viewport permits, thus truncating the contents.

#### What is the use-case or motivation for this proposal?

There are cases where modal is used to display lengthy information (long lists, rich restaurant menus, etc). In such a case designer often choose to display the modal as tall as need be, rather than displaying a scrollbar. The backdrop height is just `auto`.

#### Is there anything else we should know?

- An example of such an implementation can be found at trello.com
- I am mentioning height only, but obviously some users might also want to allow horizontal overflow for different cases.
- If there is a way to achieve that in CDK, please point me to specific place in docs.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Overlay: Allow tall modals to overflow the viewport height" (#15946)
